message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CR, cs.CC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with private information retrieval (PIR) for distributed storage systems (DSSs) with noncolluding nodes, which involves information theory (IT) and distributed systems (DS). The paper also discusses codes used for storage, which falls under coding theory (CC). The paper also addresses security concerns, which is related to cryptography (CR). Finally, the paper proposes new protocols for PIR, which can be considered as a solution in the field of systems and information (SI).
